name: Jason Clark
text:
Awesome place! Great selection! and the guys there know firearms in and out. They're very knowledgeable and know their stuff! The atmosphere there is very chill also. They didn't try to push me into buying something that i didn't even want. They make their suggestion when you tell them what you are looking for and they just kind of step back and let you make your own decision about it.

I appreciate that! I Can't stand to be pressured about buying something.
Top notch business and Top notch people there!
I'll be back👍

name: Rob Jordan
text: Today was my first time going in here, and the guys really helped me out I gave them what I wanted and price range and they made it happen. They are very knowledgeable guys and know everything it is when it comes to guns. The guys in there are easy to talk to and truly want to help you. Highly recommend.

name: Anthony Thomas
text:
Great shop, stopped in this week for the first time after my local shops all disappointed me with bad customer service.

Drove 40 minutes to get here. Staff was great, had a great selection, purchased me a new pistol chambered carbine for a great price.

resp.text: Thank you Anthony, We take pride in our customer service, and by the way we stand by our guns. We hope to have a big shipment of ammo next week. Safe shooting. Don

name: Alex Medlin
text: High prices and poor customer service

name: Mr. K
text: Really enjoyed the salesman I worked with. I knew exactly what I wanted however he showed me a more recent model that I had no idea about. His recommendation was more ideal for the purpose of my purchas . Every concern I had, he showed me a viable solution.  Thanks for the professionalism and knowledge.

name: Bobby Kilgore
text: Great store!  Anything and everything you could ever want for shooting.  People are great and know what they are doing!  Highly recommend this store.  You won't be disappointed.

resp.text: We try to please. It's all about customer service.

name: Joshua Mitchell
text: Very knowledgeable and helpful guys. At first look it may seem they don't have as many guns as a place like Academy but they actually have way cooler and more quality stuff. Plus they actually know their guns. Tom helped me find a perfect concealed carry weapon as I wasn't very familiar with the different types of handguns. They have a lot of cool surplus gear too. They are a very experienced crew who can also make a new customer feel comfortable so I would recommend this shop to new shooters or professional ones the same.

name: Herman Daniel
text: They have almost anything that you can find online but you are standing there talking to a real person. They are awesome and the only thing that I am sorry for is the fact that I had not found them sooner. Found my go to  tactical shop. Glad I found yall!!

resp.text: Thanks for finding us. We try hard to give great customer service. Thank for your business.

name: agbond003
text:
Overall, my experience at Southern Survival Store has been absolutely positive.
The Products they carry are of great quality and prices are more then reasonable. The customer service is top notch and I always feel welcome to approach them. When I ask a question or ask for an opinion on certain items, the staff will answer in a fashion that illustrates both honesty and integrity. When you have an interest in a particular item, the staff will not give you a few sale's pitch lines; instead they will tell you their actuall experience with the product. Knowing that these guys really use what they sale brings confidence in my purchases. Long story short, this is the best example of an army surplus store in every category that can be graded.
I highly encourage anyone one with outdoors, survival, or defense needs to check this place out.

name: Brian Mccall
text:
I was greeted as soon as I walked in the door, really nice staff. I was under the impression I was walking into a oldschool millitary surplus somthing like heart of dixie was so i must say i left a little disapointed but i will be back for hunting ammo for m1
I notice it was almost half price of what i paid last time

resp.text: Brian, thanks for coming into our store. We used to have lots of surplus but as you saw we are selling out of that business. We now focus on Tactical Guns and Training. Thank you for your review. Don

text: Walked in today to look for a new putter.  I left with a great putter but more importantly, I had confidence in the putter I purchased. Barry was wonderful!  He took time to ask questions about my game and what my concerns were.  Didn't try to sell me something high priced but actually worked with me to find the right putter for my particular form and stroke.  Coached me a good bit too.  At my request, we then talked about drivers.  Went to take a few swings and I can promise you that with the service I received today, I will be returning for all my golf needs including that driver - sooner rather than later.  Service makes all the difference and Barry Camilleri is patient, knowledgeable and experienced.

There was no pressure and the price was fair considering the current market. I was really hoping to get a second PWC for our Memorial Day party and I really thought it was going to be to late to make this happen. I was given the paperwork to run to DMV to register it and when I came back it was ready to go. I would highly recommend Old Guy water sports for all your PWC needs.
Thanks for a great experience!

That should be the NEW SLOGAN!!
"BUY/EAT A BURGER AND BUY A BOW!"
I get 10% if the slogan helps business.
THEY ARE OPEN TILL 8PM.

text: 2 months ago my radio goes out on my sound top(8 months old) they replace it. It goes out again last week so I drop it off again and Don tells me he'll check with owner if it's still under warranty. So today I get a call that my ranger is ready to pick up, so I'm like great I'll be there in a few. I show up and get told I owe money on repairs. I didnt authorize the repairs bc if I knew the top only had 6 month warranty I would have done it my self. It's funny the first time I was under the impression it was 12 months then it changed to 6. It's bad service when they make repairs and dont notify you first.

text: Terrible service. Took my ranger here 3 times for the same problem. $400 one time. $400 the next time. Finally found the problem and $1000. When the estimate was $300. Would not recommend bringing your ride here.

name: Nelson Quesada
text: Variety

name: Evan Chandler
text:
Kenny was a great salesman and extremely helpful to someone ready to buy their first quality bike. I told him my budget and he laid out the options within +/- ~$200 of it, while explaining exactly what benefits each bike had and how (if I wanted to) spending a bit more would save me in the effort of upgrading down the road.

I never felt pressured into going over my set limit and did not feel as though I was just dealing with someone trying to make a sale. He explained where each bike sat in performance levels and related specific components to the trails I would be riding on.

He recommended a Scott bike that was equipped with an air shock and remote lockout, both of which have been fantastic to have while out in the woods.

He also explained the current technology being used in helmets, assisting me in making the correct decision for the best protection, and even deciding on what color bottle cages/pedals would fit the bike. ("these flat black cages will complement the graphics on the bike. Yeah! Those yellow pedals will definitely work with the paint!")

Will definitely shop at Cahaba Cycles again and will call Kenny when I'm ready to upgrade to a full suspension!

name: Joseph Harter
text: Top notch bike shop! I drove 170 miles from Atlanta to buy a bike from them. Everything was ready when I got there and everyone was attentive and helpful. I was made to feel like I was more than welcome and left without having any questions that needed to be asked. Brian was amazing and helped me with everything while I was there. I would not hesitate to drive back for my next purchase. Happy Trails!

name: Kyle Hunter
text: Very knowledgeable staff and Gene, specifically, was great! They also have a huge selection of bikes. Gene was patient with me and explained all the features of the different bikes I was looking at and let me try them out behind the shop. Once I made my selection, they were able to get the bike adjusted in the time it took to pick out my accessories. I am completely satisfied with my purchase and experience and would highly recommend! I drove from Nashville to find the bike I wanted and it was worth it.

text: Cahaba Cycles was able to accommodate me with a super hard to find Marlin 6 when no one else could within a 200 mile radius. Additionally, they pulled the bike from the warehouse, assembled it, and had it ready for me within 4 days. Lastly, the employee was friendly and very helpful as I had to make my trip from North Florida. Super satisfied!

resp.text: Thank you Bryan! We appreciate it very much!

name: Mathew M.
text: Service dept is HORRIBLE! Bought a brand new Trek for my son. As soon as he tried it it was obvious one shifter didnt work at all and the rear derailleur was never adjusted. Tech refused to own that they didnt check it well before sending it out. Ordered shifter never called me to let me know. Installed shifter, never called me to let me know it was done. When I picked the bike up the rear tire was missing entire sections of tread and both tires have red mud on them even though my son only rode in the grass. Again, tech refuses to take ownership of the problem and points to me. Taken my bike there twice for repairs/adjustments but nothing is ever fixed. They also take over a week to receive brake pads for bikes they stock. Why on earth do you not stock such a common part? Service guys cannot handle a task as simple as documenting my phone number. I had to chase them around. Will never do business with them again. Wish there was a zero star option.

name: Abraham Schuster
text: Farris , Sarah, and their team treat you like family.  Relationships, expertise, and service are required to survive in an “online” world.  Cahaba cycles will thrive .

resp.text: Thanks Abe - and thank you for all your business over the years! Its always a pleasure!

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words Wes! We appreciate your business!

resp.text: Hi Jeffrey..We do purchase bikes as advertised. However, we only purchase those that fit our needs and requirements at that time. It is probable that the bike you brought by was not one that we were interested in purchasing. My apologies for any confusion.

name: Yung Cherry
text: Website said the place was open, drove a whole hour and half out of my way just to find out they are closed the entire week, so thanks, won't be making my way back.

resp.text: Dear Krunch - There must be some confusion here. The only day we ever close at this location is on Sundays, and 4 holidays (Christmas, Thanksgiving, 4th of July, and New Years) We have NEVER closed for an entire week, or even 2 days in a row for that matter. Please try us again. Our hours are posted on our website..www.cahabacycles.com

name: Lisa McDonald
text: I just attended a 3-day, 2-night girls' camp with 12 girls from 11 to 18 years, in addition to 5 other adult leaders.  Susan and Ron were absolutely wonderful to work with from the time we booked our adventure until we drove away.  Susan was very accommodating when we needed to change our schedule and quickly responded to all questions.  The girls loved the zipline, pool and lake activities as well as all of the team-building games and competitions we did, and Ron was kind enough to open the water slide which was not scheduled. The accommodations and food were great and Susan even sent us home with extra muffins!  We would definitely go again!

resp.text: Lisa, thanks for the great review.  We really enjoyed having your group here and hope to see you again.

name: David Norris
text: This was just what we were looking for! They accommodated our zip lining group ages 5 to 86 and everyone was safe and it was fun! Ron, Susan and entire staff are great. Hidden gem.

resp.text: Thanks David.  We really enjoyed your group yesterday.   Hope to see you again.

name: Sara Thompson
text: These was such a great adventure to do as a family. We stop on are way done to Florida and we are so glad we did. We did the tree adventure and zipline but we wish we could have spent more time there. Diffently take the time to stop.

resp.text: Thanks for visiting Butter and Egg Adventures.  We hope that your visit was just one of many great times your family will have while on this trip.  We thank you for stopping by and having some fun with us.

name: Charles uh60m
text: What a great place this is! My kids and I just left there and had a blast! There is so many fun things to do but I have to say zip lining was the best!

resp.text: Charles, thanks for bringing your family here yesterday.  We could tell they were having a great time.  Look forward to seeing everyone again.

name: Erin Shae
text: SO MUCH FUN! Can't wait to go back and try even more...we were there with a school group and were able to zipline, rockclimb, canoe and paddle boat, shoot eachother with lazer guns on the Battlefield (totally beat my own kid's team 😁), and eat our lunches under a covered pavillion...it was great. The staff interacts well with the kids and everybody was helpful and informative. Considering it for this year's birthday!

resp.text: Thanks for the great comments and we look forward to seeing you again!

They went above and beyond for us. We definitely got more than our money’s worth with this camp and will likely come again. The zip lines and tree adventures with high ropes course were the girl’s favorite. But the human foosball was equally fun. So many good memories made that weekend.

resp.text: Thank you Ashley, we really enjoyed having your group here!

name: Kristen Piazza
text: Went here for my birthday and had an awesome time! 😍 Went ziplining and axe throwing. 🪓Natalie and her husband were super awesome guides! They wear masks the whole time so if you're worried about Covid, don't be. Definitely go here you will not regret it!

text: We had such a fun group ! The guides were friendly and explained everything well. Natalie was a great guide and they were so accommodating of all skill sets. Can't wait to go again

name: Mary-Aileen McLemore/ Anti-Cook Girl
text: My boys (12 and 14) and I had a fantastic time! This is by far the most creative tree course we've done. The zips were the best too- lots of them for long distances unlike other places that only give you one or two of those in your package. You also can't find a better price out there for this type of adventure. We will go back!

resp.text: Thanks for taking on our three tree courses!

name: Mary-Aileen McLemore/ Anti-Cook Girl
text: My boys (12 and 14) and I had a fantastic time! This is by far the most creative tree course we've done. The zips were the best too- lots of them for long distances unlike other places that only give you one or two of those in your package. You also can't find a better price out there for this type of adventure. We will go back!

resp.text: Thanks for taking on our three tree courses!

name: Amanda Kelley
text: My daughters came to camp there July 11th through the 13th for kids camp with Crossroads Baptist Church. They came with $20.00 a piece to purchase anything of their choosing. The Adults that we’re in charge of both of my daughters money made them share $20.00. With that being said neither of my daughters were able to purchase a shirt from your camp. Not happy because we live over 2 hours away. It would be nice if y’all were able to make it to where your shirts can be purchased from your website.A staff member was very rude to my oldest daughter had I been there it wouldn’t have happened. If your staff can’t be nice to children then they don’t need to work for the camp period. I’ve heard great things about your camp. But after what happened with my daughters makes me see different.

resp.text: Amanda, we are sorry that your daughter had a bad experience at Butter and Egg Adventures.  We work hard to make sure all of our guests are treated with dignity and respect.  With that in mind, to find out more about the situation of a staff member being rude to your eldest daughter, please call 334.670.9954 or 334.670.9953 to discuss with us.  We need to find out more information, so that we can act accordingly.  On your other matter about buying a t-shirt, we had no control of your daughter's money and on how to spend it.  We certainly want to sell t-shirts to all our guests.  Our primary purpose for our website, is to provide information about our services and recreational opportunities at Butter and Egg Adventures. If you would like to buy a t-shirt at this time, please let us know and we can make arrangements to sell you one via our payment gateway.  We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Ana A
text: My daughter, her boyfriend and I went to Butter and Egg Adventure the day after New Year's Day. It was the first sunny day in weeks and we really enjoyed getting out and being active. The owners, Ron and Susan, were gracious enough to take us through the course themselves, which we thoroughly enjoyed. The grounds, structures and property are well maintained and good safety procedures are in place. We hope to return in the Spring with a bigger group of family and friends. Perfect for a family outing or activity for a big group of friends or venture groups.

name: Mrs. Rose
text: My family and I visited Camp Butter and Egg this past summer and we had a blast! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who's interested and having a ton of fun. There were various activities available for both adults and children. In addition, the staff was very welcoming and showcased excellent customer service.

name: Joe Sherwin
text: I took 17 members of our leadership team here for a staff ride where we focused on teambuilding, communication, and critical thinking skills.  Susan and Ron provided an excellent environment and program to engage our staff.  From the Escape Room to the confidence courses to the zip-lining, it was a top-notch experience.  We look forward to coming back in the near future.  Great investment!

resp.text: We enjoyed having you experience our facilities and look forward to seeing you again.

name: Anthony Roberts
text:
This place has so many fun things to do. We took a group of almost 300 people and they accommodated us well. Everyone was very helpful as far as explaining the climbing gear, how to work the ziplines and laser tag. Our lunch was hamburgers and they tasted very good and the kitchen staff did a great job of moving everyone along.

The only reason this is not a five star review is that we had several from our group complain that some of the staff were rude and not friendly, almost like they really didn't want to be there. The majority of the staff went above and beyond to help us out and for that we are very thankful.

I don't remember the young lady that helped us at the climbing wall in the beginning, but she was probably the best there that day. She was very nice and understanding to our group, and the majority of them had never climbed before so that was great.

Also, Ron took a group picture with his drone for us and all the kids loved it.

Overall I would definitely recommend this to anyone for an event or just a fun weekend with the family.

Never again.

I called and spoke with store personnel who offered an apology for the mixup and then drove the lite stove all the way to my house to keep me from having to drive back myself. They even brought me some girl scout cookies with the stove. Wonderful experience and the mishap was an honest mistake that they proactively wanted to fix. Above and beyond, folks! Bit pricey, but where else can you find it but here, service is good too. Friendly personnels are working there. We'll keep coming back for sure. Would like to avail the academy member card (but it's a credit card) and don't wanna manage another one.. so yeah.. but if you can, I would encourage you get it and enjoy alot of discounts.

Instead I had to crouch down and twirl tires to see what size they were and try to find the size I want. You cannot get a bike in a box which is tricky for storage and wrapping when you want to save the bike for a present. But good that it is assembled by a professional.

name: Amelia Blackwood
text: Their staff is amazing.  While they are definitely overworked, they remain smiling & helpful despite the overwhelming stress of not being properly staffed to serve all customer traffic.  I witnessed one customer berate an employee because the checkout line was too long of a wait. Yes - it was long, but it's not the fault of the employee, she was working as quickly as she could despite the occasional random customer walked up & interrupted her with some  question, meanwhile she's trying to continue checking out the many patiently-waiting customers in inline. Let's all remember the employees deserve our appreciation & patience during busy shopping times...and they don't make more money during those times, just more stress while the corporate folks take in the sales profits. Just try to treat everyone with the same respect you would like to receive from them.  And Academy employees deserve raises & more hired staff to create a sales team force!!!

name: John Pritchett
text: I am heading to do hurricane relief work in Big Pine Key and am gathering supplies to take with the group of us going down there. I needed to purchase some steel stakes to secure palm trees that are damaged from the storm. I went to the Montgomery Academy Sports Store and purchased these stakes. I talked with the salesman in the back and notified him of our mission and asked him if they could give us some kind of discount and was told no. I asked him to ask the manager and he did and the manager said no. When checking out of the store the manager was up front chit chatting with an employee and a customer ( doing nothing) and I again asked him face to face if he could help us out and he again said no. All the other companies have been good about discounting supplies. Lowe's of Wetumpka,  Marvins in Millbrook,  Harbour Freight,  Home Depot all have been helpful especially Lowe's in Wetumpka. After being told no face to face I told him I appreciated it and then proceeded to name the other companies that have responded responsibly. I have bought alot of product from academy over the years but this experience has left a bad test in my mouth with the company and particularly with this manager. 🚷

name: Emily Doner
text: I have not been to Academy since last spring because of poor service. I just went online ordered a pair of shoes stated I could pick up at the store within the hour. I received a call from the store that they didn’t have my item and that it would be best if I canceled my order. That my money hadn’t been taken out of my account. I tried to cancel online but it kept freezing up. I called the corporate customer service waited on hold for over 30 minutes and then they cut my call off. I then called the Decatur store back and ask for a manager. The girl that answered said “ I’m a manager” she was short and rude with me . Said they would cancel my order and I would get a email or text when it was taken care of. I did receive it and it stated my money would not be back in my bank account until 7 business days. So isn’t that great!! Academy ruins a Christmas present for my daughter. And has not a second thought or concern for me . I tried to do the right thing order from home social distance for everyone’s safety and this is the thanks I get. I paid for an item last spring $ 700 and basically the same thing happened only difference is they didn’t have my purchased item so I had to buy a $100 higher item of the same kind. I guess you make so much money that I make no difference. So I am sure I won’t be missed. But very poor service and no compassion for taking someone’s money at Christmas.. Merry Christmas Academy Sports Decatur!!

text: I stop ever time I go to Decatur if I have time always have something I need and always have something I want the staff is second to none .the manager goes out of his way to help everyone that he deals with no matter if they spend $10 or a $1000 , I'm a big gun nut and his gun counter people own guns too and I have seen them at the range and that helps on sales because they know what they are talking about instead of reading it off the box.,To me it's like going to the garage to have you truck checked out and the mechanic has to borrow a car to get to work do you really want to spend money there if he doesn't know what he is talking about? name: Jordan Morgan
text: Bought work shoes for my husband and they ended up being too small, so he went to return them the next day August 7 and it is now August 20 and still no return. I've talked to managers and customer service reps and basically have been told this store is very lacking on communication and when my husband talked to one of the managers in the store, since no one would answer the phone, they fed us a lie that it was out of their hands when truly they are the only ones who can clear the matter according to the many customer service reps I've spoke with. We are now on two weeks and still waiting for over a $100 purchase return. They could have sold the shoes in this time. They basically stole from us and we are at their mercy. My suggestion is don't do any business with these people. The carelessness I've experienced has been the biggest headache and for something that is truly so simple as a debit in-store return.

My wheelchair bound husband finally found a young man to help us but all he wanted to do was stand behind us and tell us what numbers to look for. I finally asked him if he would help my husband find the shoes he was looking for, but we found them before he actually made a move to assist us. While he was polite but unhelpful the checkout guy was helpful but verbally unpolite  with a "smart alec" attitude. I don't know what the problem was with the staff today, but we probably won't be back.
